articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Brian Mulroney steered Canada through several tumultuous reforms in the late 80s and early 90s.
articles.title: Former Canadian Prime Minister Brian Mulroney dies at 84

articles.description: Ukrainian Leonid Zakutenko sells a type of chemical online thought to be linked to at least 130 UK deaths.
articles.title: Poison seller tied to suicide forum tracked down by BBC

articles.description: There are conflicting reports about how many Palestinians were shot by Israeli forces or run over by aid lorries.
articles.title: Israel-Gaza war: More than 100 reported killed in crowd near Gaza aid convoy, Hamas-run health ministry says

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: In his annual address, Russia's president says the consequences of such a move would be tragic.
articles.title: Putin warns West against sending troops to Ukraine

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Researchers say there is an urgent need to change how the condition is tackled as it rises worldwide.
articles.title: More than a billion people obese worldwide, research suggests

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Alexei Navalny's team say undertakers have been warned not to provide a vehicle to carry his body.
articles.title: Alexei Navalny: 'No hearse for body' as family prepares funeral

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: US Trade Representative Katherine Tai says steep drop in trade with China "isn't necessarily negative".
articles.title: US says falling trade with China could be positive

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The 2019 New Zealand volcano eruption killed 22 people and gravely injured 25 others.
articles.title: White Island volcano: Tour operators ordered to pay millions to victims

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The congresswoman's son, 18, has been charged with multiple felonies over his alleged role in car break-ins.
articles.title: Lauren Boebert's son Tyler arrested, leaving congresswoman 'heartbroken'

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The Cuban government says it needs help providing children under seven years with subsidised milk.
articles.title: Cuba asks UN for help as food shortages worsen
